results.original_content:
[PHI Tagged Cases] Case ID: CASE-001, Clinical Summary
(含標記的 PHI): Patient 【PHI:NAME:P001】陳老先生【/PHI】 (Mr. 【PHI:NAME:P001】Chen【/PHI】), 【PHI:AGE_OVER_89:A001】94-year-old【/PHI】 male presenting with hip fracture. Born in 【PHI:DATE:D001】1930【/PHI】 during Japanese colonial period. Chief complaint: fell at home yesterday (【PHI:DATE:D002】Nov 21, 2024【/PHI】) and unable to stand., Contact Info
(含標記的聯絡資訊): Emergency contact: Son 【PHI:NAME:P002】陳大衛【/PHI】 at 【PHI:PHONE:T001】02-2758-9999【/PHI】. Lives alone before fall. Previous address verification: 【PHI:LOCATION:L001】台北市信義區【/PHI】 resident since 【PHI:DATE:D003】1960s【/PHI】. Medicare ID: 【PHI:ID:ID001】A123456789【/PHI】 (issued 【PHI:DATE:D004】1995【/PHI】 when patient turned 【PHI:AGE:A002】65【/PHI】)., Medical History
(含標記的時間/地點): PMH: Diagnosed with AFib in 【PHI:DATE:D005】2015【/PHI】 (age 【PHI:AGE:A003】85【/PHI】), HTN since 【PHI:DATE:D006】1995【/PHI】 (age 【PHI:AGE:A004】65【/PHI】), had appendectomy in 【PHI:DATE:D007】1945【/PHI】 (age 【PHI:AGE:A005】15【/PHI】 during WWII). Patient recalls being treated by Dr. 【PHI:NAME:P003】王【/PHI】 at 【PHI:LOCATION:L002】台大醫院【/PHI】 for TB in 【PHI:DATE:D008】1950【/PHI】 (age 【PHI:AGE:A006】20【/PHI】)., Treatment Notes
(含標記的醫師/日期): Admitted 【PHI:DATE:D009】Nov 21, 2024【/PHI】 to 【PHI:LOCATION:L003】Ortho Ward 5A Bed 512【/PHI】. Dr. 【PHI:NAME:P004】林建國【/PHI】 performed hemiarthroplasty 【PHI:DATE:D010】Nov 22【/PHI】. Post-op day 1: stable. Discharge planned 【PHI:DATE:D011】Nov 28【/PHI】., PHI Count

(含標記的 PHI): Ms. 【PHI:NAME:P005】李雅婷【/PHI】 (【PHI:NAME:P005】Lee Ya-Ting【/PHI】), 【PHI:AGE:A007】28-year-old【/PHI】 female with Huntington's Disease. Patient DNA test showed CAG repeat 43 (abnormal). Mother died age 【PHI:AGE:A008】52【/PHI】 from same disease (【PHI:DATE:D012】2018【/PHI】). Presents with chorea and behavioral changes., Contact Info

(含標記的時間/地點): Family Hx: Mother had HD (diagnosed 【PHI:DATE:D014】2005【/PHI】 age 【PHI:AGE:A010】39【/PHI】, died 【PHI:DATE:D015】2018【/PHI】 age 【PHI:AGE:A011】52【/PHI】). results.filename: 新增 Microsoft Excel 工作表.xlsx
results.original_content:
[工作表1] Case 1: 
This is a 72-year-old male patient with underlying disease of . COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) . Hypertension with regular control
•	status post intubation in 2018/12 due to severe exacerbation This time, according to the patient and his family, he suffered from increased productive cough with yellowish sputum and shortness of breath in recent three days, so he was sent to our ED (emergency department) for help. He claimed that the situation got worse since this Monday. He went to Local Clinic first and saturation there showed 88% under room air. They suspected COPD acute exacerbation. Then he was transferred to our ED (emergency department) . The doctor at ED (emergency department) arranged some test for him, including ABG (arterial blood gas) and CXR (chest X-ray) . Blood test showed respiratory acidosis with hypercapnia (PaCO2 65 mmHg), and was diagnosed of Type II respiratory failure, favored infection related. CXR (chest X-ray) showed hyperinflation and infiltration over RLL (right lower lobe). He said he went to C and D hospital these years, because he lived in Taichung with his father 明成, and used inhalers irregularly. Under the impression of COPD acute exacerbation and pneumonia, he was admitted to our ordinary ward for further survey and management.: Case 2: 
This is a 60-year-old male patient with underlying disease of . CAD (coronary artery disease) s/p PCI (percutaneous coronary intervention) . CHF (congestive heart failure) with reduced EF (ejection fraction) 35%
•	last echo done on 2024/1/10 This time, according to the patient and his caregiver, he suffered from orthopnea and bilateral lower leg edema in recent one week, so he was sent to our ED (emergency department) for help. He claimed that the situation got worse since last weekend after a heavy meal. He went to YY hospital first and CXR (chest X-ray) there showed cardiomegaly and bilateral pleural effusion. NT-proBNP elevated significantly (> 5000 pg/mL). They suspected Acute Decompensated Heart Failure. Then he was transferred to our ED (emergency department) . The doctor at ED (emergency department) arranged some test for him, including EKG and cardiac enzymes . Blood test showed mild troponin-I elevation, but no ST elevation on EKG, and was diagnosed of ADHF (acute decompensated heart failure) , favored fluid overload related. CXR (chest X-ray) showed distinct Kerley B lines. He said he went to E and F hospital these years, because he worked in Kaohsiung, and accepted diuretics adjustment monthly. His family John sign DNR for him. Under the impression of CHF flared up and pulmonary edema, he was admitted to our CCU (coronary care unit) for further survey and management.

CXR (chest X-ray) showed hyperinflation and infiltration over RLL (right lower lobe). He said he went to C and D hospital these years, because he lived in Taichung with his father 明成, and used inhalers irregularly. Under the impression of COPD acute exacerbation and pneumonia, he was admitted to our ordinary ward for further survey and management.: Case 3: 
This is a 55-year-old female patient with underlying disease of . Liver Cirrhosis, Child-Pugh score C . Chronic Hepatitis B with esophageal varices
•	history of EVL (endoscopic variceal ligation) on 2023/5/20 This time, according to the patient and her husband, she suffered from altered mental status and tea-colored urine in recent two days, so she was sent to our ED (emergency department) for help. She claimed that the situation got worse since yesterday morning. She went to ZZ hospital first and abdominal ultrasound there showed massive ascites. Ammonia level elevated significantly. They suspected Hepatic Encephalopathy. Then she was transferred to GG ED (emergency department) . The doctor忠信at ED (emergency department) arranged some test for her, including blood test and paracentesis . Blood test showed prolonged PT/APTT and hyperammonemia, and was diagnosed of Liver Cirrhosis decompensation , favored SBP (spontaneous bacterial peritonitis) rela

This is a 60-year-old male patient with underlying disease of . CAD (coronary artery disease) s/p PCI (percutaneous coronary intervention) . CHF (congestive heart failure) with reduced EF (ejection fraction) 35%
•	last echo done on 2024/1/10 This time, according to the patient and his caregiver, he suffered from orthopnea and bilateral lower leg edema in recent one week, so he was sent to our ED (emergency department) for help. He claimed that the situation got worse since last weekend after a heavy meal. He went to [REDACTED] first and CXR (chest X-ray) there showed cardiomegaly and bilateral pleural effusion. NT-proBNP elevated significantly (> 5000 pg/mL). They suspected Acute Decompensated Heart Failure. Then he was transferred to our ED (emergency department) . The doctor at ED (emergency department) arranged some test for him, including EKG and cardiac enzymes . Blood test showed mild troponin-I elevation, but no ST elevation on EKG, and was diagnosed of ADHF (acute decompensated heart failure) , favored fluid overload related. CXR (chest X-ray) showed distinct Kerley B lines. He said he went to E and F hospital these years, because he worked in Kaohsiung, and accepted diuretics adjustment monthly. His family [REDACTED] sign DNR for him. Under the impression of CHF flared up and pulmonary edema, he was admitted to our CCU (coronary care unit) for further survey and management.
